New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 10 games, a franchise record

Only four teams in NBA history have posted a better record through 35 games than the Cavaliers: Golden State (33-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (32-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (32-3) in 1971-72 and Chicago (32-3) in 1995-96
Key Match Events: Cleveland began the second quarter with a 24-6 run, fueled by its two big men, to build a commanding 53-29 lead
Donovan Mitchell had 17 of his 19 points in the second half
LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller each missed the previous three games with left ankle injuries, but came back strong and combined for 28 of Charlotteâ€™s 48 points in the first half
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland has not lost since Dec. 8 at Miami. Its lone home defeat was Nov. 27 against Atlanta
Starting small forward Isaac Okoro, who has been sidelined since Dec. 20 with a right shoulder sprain, was cleared to practice with no restrictions
The Hornets return home to play Phoenix on Tuesday. The Cavaliers host Western Conference leader Oklahoma City on Wednesday

Jarrett Allen had 19 points and 11 rebounds
